meanings.definition: To surpass in boasting or bragging.
meanings.sent1: She outvaunted her friend by claiming she could run faster.
meanings.sent2: He always outvaunted others about his achievements.
meanings.sent3: At the party, he outvaunted everyone by saying he could eat the most hot dogs.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence outvaunted the doubts of her critics.
meanings.sent5: The lion outvaunted the other animals with its loud roar.

meanings.sent1: The child outvaunted about his new toy to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: She outvaunted so much that no one believed her stories anymore.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outvaunted about finding the biggest acorn in the forest.
meanings.sent4: His outvaunting made him seem less genuine to his friends.
meanings.sent5: The peacock outvaunted its colorful feathers to attract a mate.
